medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient first presented with pericarditis at age 12, experiencing three further recurrences at one-year intervals. The current episode of retrosternal pain was treated with various medications, including colchicine and indomethacin. After 2 months, the patient returned with worsening chest pain, prompting the initiation of Anakinra treatment, resulting in improvement.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Bardet-Biedl syndrome characterized by retinitis pigmentosa, polydactyly of the left foot, kidney cysts, and learning difficulties. No previous medical history specified.
medical_history.family_history: His parents were not consanguineous, and there are no other cases of Bardet-Biedl Syndrome in the family.
